oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Colt 1861 Special Model Musket
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Colt Firearms Company Made the Special Model 1861 under contract to the Union army from 1861-1865. The Special Model varied from the normal 1861 Springfield primarily in the shape of the lock plate, hammer, and barrel bands. The parts were not interchangeable with the Model 1861 Springfield. The weapon is .58 caliber and has inspector marks and US stamps. Colt manufactured Approximately 100,000 Special Model Muskets during the Civil War.
